main event: On 30 November 1954, a meteorite struck a woman in her garden in Sylacauga, Alabama. The meteorite was described as a dark gray metallic fragment weighing 8 pounds and 9 ounces. The woman was fortunately not seriously injured.
interesting points: The meteorite weighed 8 pounds and 9 ounces and was composed of a dark gray metallic material, with partially fused outer surface and sharp, jagged edges.
The woman was struck on the left shoulder by the metallic object while working in her garden.

The area over which the object traveled was thoroughly searched and no other fragments were found. The trajectory of the object indicated it entered the atmosphere at a shallow angle and impacted the ground at a point approximately 100 yards from the woman.

The object was initially observed by many persons in the three-state area of Alabama, Georgia, and Mississippi. The object exploded at an estimated altitude of 45,000 to 50,000 ft, and the largest and only fragment recovered was the one that struck the woman.
The meteorite was identified as a member of the Andr√≥mid shower, occurring between 24 November - 7 December, indicating a connection to debris from Biela's comet which disintegrated after 1852.
witnesses: Numerous eyewitnesses in Alabama, Georgia, and Mississippi
